Description: A string of cornelian and garnet ring beads: the different stones being threaded separately. There are nearly twice as many garnet beads as there are cornelian.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Faras (Nubia), Protodynastic cemetery Cemetery 3 Grave 31 Found at the neck of the body.
Curator's comments: Also form this burial: anklets (1912,1109.27 & 1912,1109.30), beads (1912,1109.31 & 1912,1109.32 & 1912,1109.33), shell (1912,1109.28). Bibliography: F. Ll. Griffith, 'Liverpool Annals of Archaeology and Anthropology 8 (Liverpool, 1921), 15. For the occurrence of similar beads in Early Dynastic Nubia, see I. Hofmann, 'Die Kulturen des Niltals', 91, 94-5, with the references there given; also H. Åke-Nordstrom, ‘The Scandinavian Joint Expedition to Sudenese Nubia’: vols. 3:1 ‘Neolithic and A-group Sites’ (Stockholm, 1972), 125 and 3:2, pls.52 D, 194.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (158)
